reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and looks great
reviews.reviewText: This is the easiest and most spacious case I've built a computer in. It doesn't look too big from the outside, but it has ample space for cable management and accessories and it feels very solid. There's a fair amount of space above and below the motherboard, making it easy to access the screws and plug in cables. The massive cable cutout next to the motherboard is very nice too. It has ventilation on all sides with a filter on the top and bottom and I can immediately tell that it has much better airflow than my old case, partly thanks to the 6 included fans (my old case had 4).The included RGB fans look great behind the tempered glass. The fan controller is nice (supports 10 aRGB fans + 2 RGB accessories), although it uses 6 pin fans and the speed can only be controlled by the remote control (as far as I can tell). It does support a hardware switch to change colors, but that isn't included (you could wire the reset switch to be the color selector instead). There is also a motherboard sync port which seems to be a 3 pin RGB input for color control, but again, the cable isn't included. The 2 led accessory ports seem to be standard 5V RGB headers, but you need small RGB to standard RGB adapters.The accessory bag is pretty nice, it has an assortment of different screws, including radiator screws, along with a buzzer, and blank expansion plate. I wish it included the RGB adapters for the fan controller because they're somewhat hard to come by, but I was glad to see so much variety in the included parts.Finally, the case comes with no documentation and there doesn't seem to be a manual online either. It's fairly straightforward, but it was a little hard to tell what screws are meant for what, and there are no details about the features on the fan controller.Overall, for the case, plus 6 aRGB fans and a 10+2 fan controller, it's an amazing deal. While I wish it came with a manual, I'm very happy with the purchase and would definitely buy it again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For the price, you really can't beat it
reviews.reviewText: This case has a ton of value for the price. If you can get it for less than $60, it's a steal, especially for a case with side and front tempered glass panels. Lots of fan mounting options (9x 120mm fans) with mesh filters on top and bottom. Thumb screws for the side panels, and hinges for the glass panel. Excellent front I/O availability and placement. Fits a Coolermaster 212 CPU cooler (160mm). This case is functional while looking great at the same time. The only con I could think of is the front panel airflow if you use it for intake. There is <1cm gap (see photo) between the case and the front glass panel so airflow is quite restricted. Under load, internal temps (Ryzen 3600 + RX 5700) were 60-70°C with front panel on. With front panel off, it was about 15-20°C less. Personally, I just keep the front panel on and the side panel unscrewed, and when temps get high I swing open the side panel for better airflow. Overall, a great case for the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Air flow is not great but I knew that with glass front 😅
reviews.reviewText: Packaging A+This is for older pc with RGB header so this works fine with remote. It would be nice to have cables so down the road could hook to 3pin header. Price was great and ARGB fan included. Very happy with case looks amazing. I did flip top fans from exhausting to intakes since front is not pulling in much air. May need to be modified to increase air flow later.Thank you 😊4 stars due to air flow needs bigger gap between glass and fans to suck more air.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful colors, amazing product
reviews.reviewText: This product was perfect. Very beautiful, very sleek, and very very easy install. Here’s something to note, all the fans are connected as one, but you are going to need a molex cable which should be provided in the power supply u intend to purchase. Took me a long time to realize you needed molex, lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I purchased two of these, you have to buy all other accessories separately. This is an empty box. The remote controls were missing. Feels like I wasted my money. Maybe I’ll put it on offer up to sell. I already threw away the box in came in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best bang for buck case. Perfect size, comes with SIX beautiful ARGB fans, lovely tempered glass.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I absolutely LOVE this case now that I have the lighting working with my motherboard. It was an absolute STEAL for how nice it is and the fans and controller it comes with!This case comes with SIX fans attached to an ARGB fan controller. There are 3 ways to control the lighting:1: Use the included remote to cycle colours and presets.2: Connect a button to the 2-pin connector to cycle through presets. This is not included, but you can easily attach the case's "RESET" button to this connector and use it to cycle.3: Connect the fan controller to one of your your motherboards ARGB headers. Many people have been confused about how to do this, so let me explain:The case does does not come with a cable for this, but I was able to contact Bbears and they sent me one for the cost of shipping. It's a proprietary 3-pin cable to ARGB adapter. Simply connect this between the "motherboard sync" connector on the fan controller and any ARGB header on your motherboard. Then, tap the "On" button on the remote to switch it from presets to motherboard control of the fan lighting.The presets look beautiful on their own unless you have other lighted components you need to sync with. The photos and video in this review are using schemes I made using OpenRGB and AuraCreatorThe fans must be connected to the included fan controller. They do not have standard fan and RGB headers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s the best you can get for the price!
reviews.reviewText: A great mid ATX tower, has a lot of space for your graphic card! It’s also perfect for a medium desk, it has a lot of lighting effects and if you contact B Gears directly they can even send you a Motherboard link cable to control effects from your motherboard’s program, the cable is not expensive at all, and I believe is a must!

reviews.reviewerName: Al van der LaanAl van der Laan
reviews.reviewText: Very spacious to work in. I was not sure about the sturdiness, but that was a worry I should not have. The frame is very sturdy, no sharp edges. Was a bit cautious pulling the front glass off.Delivery: The box was fully intact, that is always my biggest worry. Glass has no chips and is fitting well.Is it a fish tank? I think it has some small surprises, for instance the grommets are well-placed. Paint quality is more than sufficient. I put in a full ATX board and there is plenty of space to put in a liquid cooler with three fans. The assembly was a bit tricky here and there, it is because I do not have a modular power supply. I would definitely recommend this case, if you like to look inside the computer. There is plenty of airflow as the front plate sits about 5mm away from the case. Yup, glad I put this together.Pro: Easy to assemble and build inCons: none so far.Edit: small update, I grabbed a bigger modular PSU and I just wish I could remove the disk cage without a drill (which I do not have).Still very pleased with the case, just need to learn cable management.

reviews.reviewTitle: no me vino con los ventiladores
reviews.reviewText: el gabiete esta bien pero no trae los ventiladores
Make sure you get fans with 4 pin connectors , other than that great case, cable management is decent

When it comes to the tan installation the diameter of the screw holes are just a bit large. You could compensate and get larger ones but you risk bending the aluminum and breaking the glass front. The glass front is not removable either so you can only go in though one side. The way I had gotten around this was but using industrial hot glue. I just put some hot glue on each screw before threading it. What this does is dries and acts like self fighting washers. It does the job and I’ve had no worries.
Très bonne tour mais un peut cher! Pour la qualité et vendue sans fans en plus.
